result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

from Racine County Alternatives Program - Incident Report

Prosecuting attorney Chris Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher T Taylor not in court. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Defendant had contact clerks office indicating he didnt have a ride. 
BTC: No appearance, Bench/Arrest Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited. STAYED UNTIL NEXT DATE.
Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive at all. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

*Amended 03/23/22 May drive with a VALID DRIVERS LICENSE.*

9:27 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher T Taylor in court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant does not have counsel, working to retain private counsel. defendant requests bond be modified to allow driving 
State objects to any modification of bond based on the complaint and charges wihtin it.

BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits for holding a preliminary hearing to allow defendant to retain counsel. Motion to modify bond is granted to allow driving WITH a valid License.
